Class AbstractMenuAction

Direct Known Subclasses:
CloseAction, CollapseSameArrangementsAction, CreateDomainTreeAction, CreateSpeciesTreeAction, CreateTreeAction, CreateViewUsingSelectionAction, ExportViewAsImageAction, FindArrangementAction, FindDomainAction, FitDomainsToScreenAction, ImportDataAction, LoadBigExampleDataAction, LoadProjectAction, LoadSmallExampleDataActon, MsaViewAction, ProportionalViewAction, SaveProjectAction, SaveXdomFileAction, SelectDomainArrangementsAction, SelectSequencesAction, ShowAnnotatorAction, ShowConfigurationAction, ShowDistMatrixAction, ShowDomainGraphAction, ShowDomainLegendAction, ShowDomainMatrixAction, ShowDomainRulerAction, ShowDotplotAction, ShowManualAction, ShowShapesAction, ShowStatisticsAction, ToggleZoomModeAction, UnproportionalViewAction
public abstract class AbstractMenuAction
extends javax.swing.AbstractAction

The abstract class AbstractMenuAction makes it possible to set all Action specific settings for MenuEntrys.
In other words a MenuEntry like a JMenuItem is based on a defined Action, which holds the settings for its name, shortcut, image, tooltip, ...
To trigger specific methods just implement the actionPerformed(ActionEvent) method in a subclass of AbstractMenuAction and use the path to this subclass within the xml formatted menu file, as action url.
Example: "main.ui.actions.ImportDataAction"

Author:
Andreas Held
